subject: Re: [junit] Displaying test case information during execution.
msgSnippet: On Thu, 13 Nov 2003 20:32:10 -0000, gjanyavula  ... Bare minimum: you could create your own TestCase that all of your tests extend from
messageBody:
On Thu, 13 Nov 2003 20:32:10 -0000, "gjanyavula" <gjanyavula@...>
said:
> I apologize if this is a repeat questions. I did some searching in
> the message archive but couldn't find the answer to my question.
>
> History: I'm running a test suite which has some test cases from with
> in a servlet.
>
> Question: I want to be able to display
>
> 1. TestCase name
> 2. TestCase method name
>
> during execution of each method of every test case. How do I
> accomplish this ?

Bare minimum: you could create your own TestCase that all of your tests
extend from (instead of junit.framework.TestCase). In that TestCase you
would override runBare():

public void runBare() throws Throwable {
display(this.getClass().getName());
display(getName());
super.runBare();
}

(I hope my memory served me right on that one...)

It all depends on your specific needs...

--
=jason
[:question | ^One]
